name: Fly Fishing
description: Fly fishing is the most popular technique for Bend area trout. The clear waters and abundant insect hatches make Central Oregon a world-class fly fishing destination.

name: Lure Fishing
description: Lure fishing is effective for trout, bass, and salmon. Spinners and spoons are particularly effective in the Deschutes River and reservoirs.

name: Bait Fishing
description: Bait fishing can be very effective, especially for stocked fish and in reservoirs. PowerBait, nightcrawlers, and salmon eggs are popular choices.

name: Trolling
description: Trolling is the most effective technique for kokanee in reservoirs. It allows you to cover water and find actively feeding fish.

name: Nymph Fishing
description: Nymphing is the most consistent way to catch trout in Bend waters. Fish feed underwater on insect nymphs for 90% of their diet.

name: Dry Fly Fishing
description: Dry fly fishing is the most exciting way to catch trout as you see the rise. Central Oregon has excellent hatches from May through October.
